newsitem.title: LEBANON: Israeli warplanes rocket south Lebanon.
newsitem.headline: Israeli warplanes rocket south Lebanon.

text.p: Israeli warplanes on Wednesday rocketed suspected Hizbollah guerrilla targets in south Lebanon's highlands, Lebanese security sources said.

Jets fired four rockets into the Iqlim al-Toufah mountain ridge from which the pro-Iranian Hizbollah (Party of God) launches guerrilla raids on Israeli troops in a south Lebanon occupation zone, the sources said.
The raid followed two separate attacks by Moslem guerrillas in south Lebanon on Tuesday in which four fighters of the pro-Israeli South Lebanon Army (SLA) militia were wounded.
It was not immediately known if there were any casualties in the air raid, the third on Lebanon in less than a week.

The warplanes struck as representatives of five nations monitoring a U.S.-sponsored April 26 ceasefire understanding between Lebanon and Israel met at the headquarters of U.N. peacekeeping troops in the southern village of Naqoura.
The ceasefire understanding bars attacks launched at or from civilian areas.
Delegates of France, Lebanon, Israel, Syria and the United States met to discuss Lebanese and Israeli complaints about clashes last week between Hizbollah and Israeli troops.

Lebanon called the meeting to protest about Israeli shelling of civilian areas last Thursday after Hizbollah killed two Israeli soldiers and wounded eight in the 15-km (nine miles)-wide occupation zone.
A Lebanese civilian woman was wounded in the Israeli bombardment.
Israel countered at a meeting of the committee on Tuesday with a complaint that Hizbollah fired at its troops from south Lebanon villages.
